note.p: Birth: The sign of the Seven Stars, Birchin Lane, London, England, Europe (24 April 1620)
Death: Bolt Court, London, England, Europe (18 April 1674)
Burial: St Dunstan-in-the-West, Fleet Street, London, England, Europe (22 April 1674)
Occupation: Shopkeeper
Research Field: Statistics, demography
Education: Apprenticeship with haberdasher of small wares (1636)

Career: Admitted freeman of Drapers' Company (1641); Author of 'Natural and Political Observations on the Bills of Mortality' (1662); Manager of the New River Company (1666); Member of the Common Council of the City of London; involved in actuarial work
Membership: Original Fellow
Election Date: 20/05/1663
Council: On Council (1664-1666)
Committee appointments include: Committee for the Histories of Trades (1664)
Other RSActivity: Worked and associated closely with William Petty (FRS 1660), in particular regarding statistical accounts.
Brought in reports on the growth of carps and salmons (1663).
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Aubrey; ODNB
References: T. Sprat, History of the Royal Society 1667 (p 67)
Peter Brimblecombe, 'Interest in Air Pollution Among Early Fellows of the Royal Society' in NR 1977-8 vol 32 pp 123-129
D V Glass, 'John Graunt and his Natural and Political Observations' in NR 1964 vol 19 pp 63-100
Sir Irvine Masson and A J Youngson, 'Sir William Petty, FRS (1623-1687)' in NR 1960 vol 15 pp 79-90
M Greenwood, 'The First Life Table' in NR 1938 vol 1 pp 70-72

Notes: The election date is Graunt's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously admitted into the Society on 26 February 1662.
Hunter has admission date 5 March 1662, which Journal Book states is the day of subscription.
